title: Font used in this infographic
content:
Hi all,

Can anyone identify the font used in [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415031323/http:/blog.sumall.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/TheinternetIsAZoo-e1413838839489.jpg) infographic? I guess you can call it an infographic. I think there's just one font used. If you click on the image it zooms to a hundred percent.

Many thanks in advance.
author: AngelFlonne

comments.content:
I think it's various weights of [Proxima Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415031323/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fwww.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/proxima-nova/) with some alternates turned on (e.g. lower case 'a').

- Lex
Hi Lex, thanks for replying, that's what I thought initially but when I checked it the large numerals appear to be different. Isn't there another font being used too?

The numbers look DIN-ish in construction. Similar, but not a match: [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/tdf/galeb/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415031323/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/tdf/galeb/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/tdf/galeb/")

The closest I can come on the numbers—and it’s not a spot-0n match—is Antagometrica:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/antagometrica/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415031323/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/antagometrica/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/antagometrica/")

The bowls of the numbers in the sample are nearly round, and finding that paired with a squared-off |0| and that |1| has proven to be a challenge.
That was my first reaction, maybe I'm better at recognizing fonts than I thought :) If most of the document is Proxima Nova that's a partial success at any rate.

Can't identify it either but... digged a bit more and found the Proxima Nova webfont on their [blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415031323/http:/blog.sumall.com/) embeds the exact same set of digits as the infographics. As this information gets this case even fuzzier, your best chance now may probably be [asking them directly](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415031323/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fsumall.com/contact).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415031323im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_4627.png)
Okay thanks for looking into it for me. It looks like they replaced the numerals with a different font then. That would explain why it seemed unusual :)

> It looks like they replaced the numerals with a different font then.

Exactly but it doesn't solve the mystery either :) Hope they could give (us) the answer.
